title: SQL ServerCONCAT_WS()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerCONCAT_WS()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Add strings together. Use '.' to separate the concatenated string 
values:
SELECT 
  CONCAT_WS('.', 'www', '', 'com');

Definition and Usage
The CONCAT_WS() function adds two or more strings together with a separator.
Note:
See also
CONCAT()
and
Concat with the + operator
.
Syntax
CONCAT_WS(
separator, string1
,
string2
,
....
,
string_n
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
separator
Required. The separator to use
string1, string2, string_n
Required. The strings to add together
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2017), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Add strings together. Use '-' to separate the concatenated string 
values:
SELECT 
  CONCAT_WS('-', 'SQL', ' is', ' fun!');

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerCONCAT_WS()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerCONCAT_WS()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
